hypothesis_content.title: Asymmetric ETF Flow Impact in Neutral Regime
hypothesis_content.statement: In a NEUTRAL regime (confidence 55-70%), a single-day Bitcoin ETF net outflow exceeding $300M will have a disproportionately large negative impact on BTC price (-2 to -4%) over the next 24 hours compared to the impact of equivalent inflows (+1 to +2%), due to negative sentiment amplification and derivative market deleveraging.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In uncertain (Neutral) markets, negative catalysts are psychologically weighted more heavily than positive ones (loss aversion). Large ETF outflows are a tangible, headline-grabbing metric that can trigger retail fear, force liquidations in leveraged long positions, and lead to negative feedback loops not seen with similar-sized inflows.
entry_conditions: Daily net BTC ETF flows reported < -$300M
BTC price has not already dropped >3% in the 6 hours prior to flow report
Enter short on BTC perpetual swap at market open following flow report confirmation
hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The average 24hr return after >$300M outflows is not significantly more negative (p<0.05) than the average return after >$300M inflows is positive, or the strategy has a win rate < 60%.
